result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron M Burrows

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Byron M Burrows in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Byron M Burrows.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Order for Examination, signed and filed. 
Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Collins on 11-07-2022 at 10:00 am. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Byron M Burrows appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Byron M Burrows.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel raised competency. Court informed parties that due to court reporter availability, defense counsel raising competency will need to be scheduled to an in person date.
Court ordered case adjourned for Further Proceedings in Branch 15.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Byron M Burrows appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Byron M Burrows.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. State is in compliance with victim notification. Offer and discovery has been turned over. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Barbara R (BDR) or Yuonne G (YG).  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Byron M Burrows in court with attorney Scott Michael Nelson.  Defendant Byron M Burrows in custody.  Sara Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Byron M Burrows appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
